definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The development of financial circles and strick precaution of the risk are closely linked with disclosure of financial information.
sentences.chinese: 金融業的發展及其風險的防範與信息披露息息相關。

sentences.english: Bankers have described the supertax as confirmation of the UK's hostility to finance.
sentences.chinese: 銀行家形容，附加稅證實了英國對金融業的敵意。

sentences.english: His depiction of finance's failures is not novel- however it is well done.
sentences.chinese: 他對金融業失敗的描述並不希奇，卻相當到位。

sentences.english: The intense reflection is stirred with the startup of medium-term notes(MTN).
sentences.chinese: 中期票據市場的啓動在我國金融業引起強烈反響。

sentences.english: The trend in applying satellite communication in American financial institutions is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析美國金融業應用衛星技術的趨勢。

sentences.english: This game of whack-a-mole has changed global finance.
sentences.chinese: 這種打地鼠遊戲已改變了全球金融業。

sentences.english: Peter is following in his father's footsteps and going into banking.
sentences.chinese: 彼得準備繼承父業，從事金融業。

sentences.english: Each time, the financial sector rose, phoenix-like, from the ashes.
sentences.chinese: 每一次，金融業都像鳳凰般浴火重生。

sentences.english: A lot of mathematics majors go into that, and it's like, just like, in New York finance.
sentences.chinese: 很多數學專業的學生都會從商，比若說去紐約金融業。

sentences.english: Now the housing bubble has burst in turn, leaving the financial landscape strewn with wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 現在輪到地產泡沫破滅了，使得整個金融業屍橫遍野。

sentences.english: More over, the stock industry is the most unsubstantial.
sentences.chinese: 而在金融業中，證券業又是最薄弱的。

sentences.english: But now that industry, like much of finance, is withering.
sentences.chinese: 但現在業內，就像許多金融業一樣，枯萎了。

sentences.english: Pilcher gave up his career in finance to pursue the idea.
sentences.chinese: 皮爾策放棄他在金融業的事業去追求理想。

sentences.english: Just six months ago, profits were sky-high in the financial sector.
sentences.chinese: 就在6個月前，金融業還是利潤極高的產業。

sentences.english: Presently, the financial system of real estate is still unhealthful.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個特點就決定了房地產業需要金融業的大力支持。

sentences.english: America's banks received extraordinary a istance from American taxpayers to rebuild their industry.
sentences.chinese: 美國銀行從納稅人那裏得到巨大援助來重振金融業。

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
